metadata.Title: CVE-2022-33741 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Linux disk/nic frontends data leaks T[his CNA information record relates tomultiple CVEs; the text explains which aspects/vulnerabilities correspondto which CVE.] Linux Block and Network PV device frontends don't zeromemory regions before sharing them with the backend (CVE-2022-26365,CVE-2022-33740). Additionally the granularity of the grant table doesn'tallow sharing less than a 4K page, leading to unrelated data residing inthe same 4K page as data shared with a backend being accessible by suchbackend (CVE-2022-33741, CVE-2022-33742).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-33741` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-194.205
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-194.205
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-194.205
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-194.205
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-194.205
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-128.144~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-194.205').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
